intro: Blepharis glomerata, commonly known as clustered tasselweed, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Blepharis glomerata is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a hardy, low-maintenance plant for xeriscaping.
